title.narrative: USAID Interagency Agreement with USDA Forest Service

description.narrative: (Georgia): USAID in partnership with U.S. Forest Service (USFS) will provide technical assistance for natural resource management to Georgian government agencies, including the Ministry of Environmental Protection, Forestry Agency, Ministry of Agriculture, and environmental NGOs. Georgia is currently reorganizing forest sector policies and institutions, and hiring a new cadre of forestry personnel. USFS technical assistance for these efforts will include training and advisory services on sustainable forest management with resulting benefits for biodiversity, economic development, governance and institution building objectives. Technical assistance will also be provided to rural communities to improve grazing practices to address erosion and mitigate the risk of natural disasters such as mudslides and floods in rural Georgia. This activity will support the effective management of forest resources, including improved planning and enforcement of practices, which is expected to reduce unsustainable logging practices and retention of forest coverage resulting in the reduction of emissions and climate change mitigation. This activity also indirectly contributes to climate change adaptation objectives as it works to address poor forestry, grazing, and rural road construction practices in Georgia that create increased erosion, resulting in polluted watersheds/rivers and increased risks for natural disasters, including mudslides, landslides, and floods. Proper forest management will make forests more resilient in the face of climate change. (IM#54074 $630,000 Indirect GCC-SL; and $120,000 Indirect GCC-AD.)This assistance contributes to the biodiversity earmark and focuses on the entire territory of Georgia, including the autonomous region of Adjara but excluding the breakaway regions of Abkhazia and South Ossettia.
